segment.name: dataElementErrorIndication
segment.desc: To identify an erroneous simple, composite or component data element, and to identify the nature of the error.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the syntax error detected.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a simple or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the simple or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following simple or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

segment.name: functionalGroupResponse
segment.desc: To identify a functional group in the subject interchange and to indicate acknowledgement or rejection (action taken) of the UNG and UNE segments, and to identify any error related to these segments. Depending on the action code, it may also indicate the action taken on the messages within that functional group.

data_element.name: functionalGroupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the sender's division, department etc.

composite_data_element.name: applicationSendersIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender's division, department etc. from which a group of message is sent.

data_element.name: senderIdentification
data_element.desc: Code or name identifying the division, department etc. within the originating sender's organization.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

composite_data_element.name: applicationRecipientsIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient's division, department etc. for which a group of messages is intended.

data_element.name: recipientsIdentification
data_element.desc: Code or name identifying the division, department etc. within the recipient's organization for which the group of messages is intended.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

data_element.name: actionCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating acknowledgement, or rejection (the action taken) of a subject interchange, or part of the subject interchange.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the syntax error detected.

data_element.name: serviceSegmentTagCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a segment.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a simple or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the simple or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following simple or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

segment.name: interchangeResponse
segment.desc: To identify the subject interchange, to indicate interchange receipt, to indicate acknowledgement or rejection (action taken) of the UNA, UNB and UNZ segments, and to identify any error related to these segments. Depending on the action code, it may also indicate the action taken on the functional groups and messages within that interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeSender
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: senderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded representation of the sender of a data interchange.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

data_element.name: addressForReverseRouting
data_element.desc: Address specified by the sender of an interchange to be included by the recipient in the response interchanges to facilitate internal routing.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: recipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded representation of the recipient of a data interchange.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

data_element.name: routingAddress
data_element.desc: Address specified by the recipient of an interchange to be included by the sender and used by the recipient for routing of received interchanges inside his organization.

data_element.name: actionCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating acknowledgement, or rejection (the action taken) of a subject interchange, or part of the subject interchange.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the syntax error detected.

data_element.name: serviceSegmentTagCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a segment.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a simple or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the simple or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following simple or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

segment.name: messageResponse
segment.desc: To identify a message in the subject interchange, and to indicate that message's acknowledgement or rejection (action taken), and to identify any error related to the UNH and UNT segments.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: messageIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the type, version etc. of the message being interchanged.

data_element.name: messageType
data_element.desc: Code identifying a type of message and assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message type version number (0052).

data_element.name: controllingAgency
data_element.desc: Code to identify the agency controlling the specification, maintenance and publication of the message type.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: A code assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: actionCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating acknowledgement, or rejection (the action taken) of a subject interchange, or part of the subject interchange.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the syntax error detected.

data_element.name: serviceSegmentTagCoded
data_element.desc: Code identifying a segment.

composite_data_element.name: dataElementIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the position for an erroneous data element. This can be the position of a simple or composite data element in the definition of a segment or a component data element in the definition a composite data element.

data_element.name: erroneousDataElementPositionInSegment
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the simple or composite data element in error. The segment code and each following simple or composite data element defined in the segment description shall cause the count to be incremented. The segment tag has position number 1.

data_element.name: erroneousComponentDataElementPosition
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of the component data element in error. Each component data element position defined in the composite data element description shall cause the count to be incremented. The count starts at 1.

segment.name: segmentErrorIndication
segment.desc: To identify either a segment containing an error or a missing segment, and to identify any error related to the complete segment.

data_element.name: segmentPositionInMessage
data_element.desc: The numerical count position of a specific segment that is within the actual received message. The numbering starts with, and includes, the UNH segment as segment number 1. To identify a segment that contains an error, this is the numerical count position of that segment. To report that a segment is missing, this is the numerical count position of the last segment that was processed before the position where the missing segment was expected to be. A missing segment group is denoted by identifying the first segment in the group as missing.

data_element.name: syntaxErrorCoded
data_element.desc: A code indicating the syntax error detected.

segment.name: interchangeHeader
segment.desc: To start, identify and specify an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: syntaxIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the agency controlling the syntax and indication of syntax level, plus the syntax version number.

data_element.name: syntaxIdentifier
data_element.desc: Coded identification of the agency controlling a syntax and syntax level used in an interchange.

data_element.name: syntaxVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of the syntax identified in the syntax identifier (0001)

composite_data_element.name: interchangeSender
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender of the interchange.

data_element.name: senderIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded representation of the sender of a data interchange.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

data_element.name: addressForReverseRouting
data_element.desc: Address specified by the sender of an interchange to be included by the recipient in the response interchanges to facilitate internal routing.

composite_data_element.name: interchangeRecipient
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient of the interchange.

data_element.name: recipientIdentification
data_element.desc: Name or coded representation of the recipient of a data interchange.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

data_element.name: routingAddress
data_element.desc: Address specified by the recipient of an interchange to be included by the sender and used by the recipient for routing of received interchanges inside his organization.

composite_data_element.name: datetimeOfPreparation
composite_data_element.desc: Date/time of preparation of the interchange.

data_element.name: dateOfPreparation
data_element.desc: Local date when an interchange or a functional group was prepared.

data_element.name: timeOfPreparation
data_element.desc: Local time of day when an interchange or a functional group was prepared.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.

composite_data_element.name: recipientsReferencePassword
composite_data_element.desc: Reference or password as agreed between the communicating partners.

data_element.name: recipientsReferencepassword
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the recipient to the data interchange or a password to the recipient's system or to a third party network as specified in the partners interchange agreement.

data_element.name: recipientsReferencepasswordQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier for the recipient's reference or password.

data_element.name: applicationReference
data_element.desc: Identification of the application area assigned by the sender, to which the messages in the interchange relate e.g. the message identifier if all the messages in the interchange are of the same type.

data_element.name: processingPriorityCode
data_element.desc: Code determined by the sender requesting processing priority for the interchange.

data_element.name: acknowledgementRequest
data_element.desc: Code determined by the sender for acknowledgement of the interchange.

data_element.name: communicationsAgreementId
data_element.desc: Identification by name or code of the type of agreement under which the interchange takes place.

data_element.name: testIndicator
data_element.desc: Indication that the interchange is a test.

segment.name: functionalGroupTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a functional group.

data_element.name: numberOfMessages
data_element.desc: A count of the number of messages in a functional group.

data_element.name: functionalGroupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the sender's division, department etc.

segment.name: functionalGroupHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a functional group.

data_element.name: functionalGroupIdentification
data_element.desc: Identification of the one type of message in a functional group.

composite_data_element.name: applicationSendersIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the sender's division, department etc. from which a group of message is sent.

data_element.name: senderIdentification
data_element.desc: Code or name identifying the division, department etc. within the originating sender's organization.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

composite_data_element.name: applicationRecipientsIdentification
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the recipient's division, department etc. for which a group of messages is intended.

data_element.name: recipientsIdentification
data_element.desc: Code or name identifying the division, department etc. within the recipient's organization for which the group of messages is intended.

data_element.name: partnerIdentificationCodeQualifier
data_element.desc: Qualifier referring to the source of codes for the identifiers of interchanging partners.

composite_data_element.name: datetimeOfPreparation
composite_data_element.desc: Date/time of preparation of the interchange.

data_element.name: dateOfPreparation
data_element.desc: Local date when an interchange or a functional group was prepared.

data_element.name: timeOfPreparation
data_element.desc: Local time of day when an interchange or a functional group was prepared.

data_element.name: functionalGroupReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by the sender's division, department etc.

data_element.name: controllingAgency
data_element.desc: Code to identify the agency controlling the specification, maintenance and publication of the message type.

composite_data_element.name: messageVersion
composite_data_element.desc: Specification of the type of messages in the functional group.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message type version number (0052).

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: A code assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: applicationPassword
data_element.desc: Password to the recipient's division, department or sectional system (if required).

segment.name: messageHeader
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a message.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

composite_data_element.name: messageIdentifier
composite_data_element.desc: Identification of the type, version etc. of the message being interchanged.

data_element.name: messageType
data_element.desc: Code identifying a type of message and assigned by its controlling agency.

data_element.name: messageVersionNumber
data_element.desc: Version number of a message type.

data_element.name: messageReleaseNumber
data_element.desc: Release number within the current message type version number (0052).

data_element.name: controllingAgency
data_element.desc: Code to identify the agency controlling the specification, maintenance and publication of the message type.

data_element.name: associationAssignedCode
data_element.desc: A code assigned by the association responsible for the design and maintenance of the message type concerned, which further identifies the message.

data_element.name: commonAccessReference
data_element.desc: Reference serving as a key to relate all subsequent transfers of data to the same business case or file.

composite_data_element.name: statusOfTheTransfer
composite_data_element.desc: Statement that the message is one in a sequence of transfers relating to the same topic.

data_element.name: sequenceOfTransfers
data_element.desc: Number assigned by the sender indicating the numerical sequence of one or more transfers.

data_element.name: firstAndLastTransfer
data_element.desc: Indication used for the first and last message in a sequence of the same type of message relating to the same topic.

segment.name: sectionControl
segment.desc: To separate header, detail and summary sections of a message. note: To be used by message designers when required to avoid ambiguities. Mandatory only if specified for the type of message concerned.

data_element.name: sectionIdentification
data_element.desc: Separates sections in a message.

segment.name: messageTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a message.

data_element.name: numberOfSegmentsInTheMessage
data_element.desc: Control count of number of segments in a message.

data_element.name: messageReferenceNumber
data_element.desc: Unique message reference assigned by the sender.

segment.name: interchangeTrailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of an interchange.

data_element.name: interchangeControlCount
data_element.desc: The count either of the number of messages or, if used, of the number of functional groups in an interchange. One of these counts shall appear.

data_element.name: interchangeControlReference
data_element.desc: Unique reference assigned by the sender to an interchange.
